annotation.spannedText: overall, the news is gratifying in that the overwhelming majority of parents continue to vaccinate their children

classMention.mentionClass: overall, the news is gratifying in that the overwhelming majority of parents continue to vaccinate their children

annotation.spannedText: even small pockets of undervaccinated children can fuel an outbreak, such as the recent Disney-linked measles outbreak

classMention.mentionClass: even small pockets of undervaccinated children can fuel an outbreak, such as the recent Disney-linked measles outbreak

annotation.spannedText: Immunization programs count on high uptake not only to protect vaccinated children, but also to protect infants and those who can't be vaccinated for medical reasons

classMention.mentionClass: Immunization programs count on high uptake not only to protect vaccinated children, but also to protect infants and those who can't be vaccinated for medical reasons

annotation.spannedText: Anne Schuchat, MD, director of the CDC's National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases

classMention.mentionClass: Anne Schuchat, MD, director of the CDC's National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases
